intro: Lycianthes glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the evening. Its fruit is a capsule containing numerous small, black seeds. This species is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
